content: grr string designed by catie berger a fast and fun little project to crochet designed to coordinate with the grr pasties use up your leftover sock and novelty yarns and let your imagination run wild yarn leftover sock/fingering yarn and eyelash yarn shown in opal tiger with and unknown black eyelash yarn from the stash approximately 2 yards of ¾ wide ribbon is needed for the ties hook us e 3 5mm front ch3 single_crochet in 2nd chain single_crochet ch1 turn 3sc row 1 single_crochet to last stitch 2 single_crochet in last single_crochet chain 1 turn 4sc row 2-27 repeat row 1 increasing 1 single_crochet each row until you have 30sc row 28 ch2 counts as double_crochet double_crochet ch2 dc2 7 times ch1 turn row 29 single_crochet in each stitch across 30 single_crochet finish off back work same as front through row 11 row 12 ch2 counts as double_crochet double_crochet ch2 dc2 3 times ch1 turn row 13 single_crochet in each stitch across 30 single_crochet finish off finishing with rs facing attach yarn with a single_crochet in the first chain of the foundation row of the back single_crochet around the triangle working 3sc in each corner slip_stitch into first single_crochet chain approx 6 or desired length with rs facing single_crochet in first chain of the front single_crochet around the front as for the back slip_stitch into 1st single_crochet single_crochet in each chain be carful not to twist slip_stitch into last single_crochet on the back finish off *with rs facing attach the eyelash yarn to the back with a single_crochet in 1st single_crochet at the top single_crochet in each single_crochet across ch1 turn single_crochet in each single_crochet finish off repeat from * for front weave in ends weave 1yd lengths of ribbon through the eyelets on the front and the back tie at the sides
